questions.question: How many primary jurisdictions does TSAA recognize as operating on Earth?
options: Four — land, sea, air, and digital

questions.question: Which jurisdiction applies to the living men and women on the land and soil?
What does “Admiralty Law” primarily govern according to TSAA teachings?
options: Contracts and commerce between vessels and corporations
The land-based activities of farmers and property owners

questions.question: What event allowed corporate governments to extend maritime jurisdiction onto the land unlawfully?
options: The registration of all living births as “persons”
The adoption of the Gregorian calendar

questions.question: What is the proper jurisdiction for enforcing Public Law?
options: Land and soil jurisdiction under Common Law

questions.question: What is the primary difference between statutory law and common law?
options: Statutory law applies only to foreigners
Common law is natural and moral; statutory law is corporate and written
Common law is used in banking; statutory law is used in trade
They are two names for the same system

questions.question: According to TSAA, what does the term “Legal Fiction” refer to?
options: A corporate entity or person created on paper
A law that has not yet been published

questions.question: Why do lawful people reject the title “citizen” in Assembly context?
options: Because it implies voluntary political allegiance to a corporate state
Because it refers to ancient Roman slaves
Because it has no meaning under Common Law

questions.question: What document process reclaims a person’s lawful standing from corporate jurisdiction?
Under lawful principles, what defines a valid crime?
options: The existence of a living victim or measurable harm
A court’s accusation against a person
The issuance of a fine by a judge
